skill.name: develop
skill.description: General principles for exploring, developing, editing, and refactoring code. Use for codebase analysis, implementation tasks, and code quality improvements.
skill.summary: General principles for exploring, developing, editing, and refactoring code. Use for codebase analys...
skill.author: 0xmsc

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only guidance and best practices. No executable code, no network calls, no filesystem access, no command execution. Contains only markdown documentation for code development principles.

content.value_statement: This skill provides guidelines for writing maintainable code and following best practices during development. It helps developers create cleaner, more reliable software through structured planning and quality-focused workflows.
actual_capabilities: Provides planning frameworks for non-trivial changes
Establishes code quality standards and best practices
Defines git safety protocols and atomic commit guidelines
Promotes error handling and edge case consideration
limitations: Does not execute code or run commands
Does not access external APIs or services
Does not modify files without explicit user approval
Does not handle deployment or infrastructure tasks

use_cases.title: Write maintainable code
use_cases.description: Apply clean code principles when implementing new features or fixing bugs

use_cases.title: Review code changes
use_cases.description: Ensure code changes follow established patterns and quality standards

use_cases.title: Enforce coding standards
use_cases.description: Guide team members on proper planning and commit practices

prompt_templates.title: Explore codebase
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me understand this codebase structure. What are the main modules and their responsibilities?

prompt_templates.title: Plan feature
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to add a new feature that [description]. What clarifying questions should I ask before starting?

prompt_templates.title: Implement safely
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement the changes we discussed. Follow atomic commit principles and document the intent of each change.

prompt_templates.title: Refactor legacy code
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me refactor this function to follow clean code principles while maintaining its behavior.

output: â€¢ Ask clarifying questions about auth method, security requirements, and integration points
â€¢ Present a plan with 3+ questions and proposed answers
â€¢ Wait for user approval before implementing
â€¢ Make atomic commits grouped by functionality
â€¢ Match existing code patterns and style

best_practices: Always present a plan with clarifying questions before implementing non-trivial changes
Use atomic commits that group logically related changes together
Document intent and reasoning, not just mechanical changes
anti_patterns: Making changes without explicit user approval for non-trivial tasks
Catching exceptions silently instead of letting them bubble up
Rewriting entire files when targeted edits would suffice

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, OpenAI Codex, and Claude Code. Each tool interprets the guidance according to its capabilities.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: This skill provides guidelines only. It does not execute code, access files directly, or make decisions without user input.

faq.question: How does this integrate with other skills?
faq.answer: For complex strategies, use the plan skill first. Then apply development principles from this skill during implementation.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This skill contains only text guidelines. It does not access files, networks, or external services independently.

faq.question: What if guidelines conflict with project standards?
faq.answer: Follow existing project patterns first. Use this skill's principles when no project-specific guidance exists.

faq.question: How is this different from a linter?
faq.answer: Linters enforce syntax rules automatically. This skill provides higher-level guidance on architecture, planning, and code quality.
